sense.name: a military battle, hostilities between armies
sense.examples: The engagement of the two armies occurred at the outskirts of the city. The tribunal concluded that the soldiers had obeyed the rules of engagement.

sense.name: a prearranged meeting
sense.examples: John has a previous engagement this evening and can't come to our party. I rescheduled a lunch engagement in order to hear his lecture.

sense.name: betrothal, a mutual promise to marry
sense.examples: Sally and Pete announced their engagement at the company picnic. Her engagement to him lasted only six months before they broke it off.

sense.name: the act of giving someone a job, hiring someone
sense.examples: Their engagement of a new nanny was done in haste. The engagement of a private tour guide is still being discussed.

sense.name: paid employment for performers, performances
sense.examples: The jazz band has a 2-night engagement at the Plaza Hotel. The agency has booked the dance group for several engagements on the east coast.

sense.name: act of coming into gear, interlocking
sense.examples: The engagement of the clutch doesn't feel quite right. The precision sanding ensures a smooth engagement of gears.

sense.name: participation or involvement with something
sense.examples: The teacher tried to increase the children's engagement in class activities. He is on trial for his engagement in insider trading.
